content.thinking:
I need to answer the question about whether there are ranks higher than a captain in military hierarchy with just "yes" or "no".

In military hierarchies across different branches and countries, there are indeed ranks higher than captain. In most military structures:

- Army, Air Force, and Marine Corps hierarchy (US example):
  - Captain is an O-3 rank
  - Above captain are: Major (O-4), Lieutenant Colonel (O-5), Colonel (O-6), Brigadier General (O-7), Major General (O-8), Lieutenant General (O-9), General (O-10)

- Navy hierarchy:
  - Captain in the Navy is actually higher (O-6)
  - But there are still higher ranks: Rear Admiral (O-7/O-8), Vice Admiral (O-9), Admiral (O-10), Fleet Admiral (O-11)

So yes, there are ranks higher than captain in military hierarchy. I'll respond with just "yes" as instructed.
